content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Haoyu Wang from China.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of this conversation was the rental price for the apartment in München.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why didn't you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: The reason we didn't agree on a final price was that I, as the landlord, was not willing to accept the price offered by the potential tenant, Haoyu Wang. I always aim for the highest price possible, and his offer was not satisfactory to me.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Understood. Thank you for your honesty. Moving on to the next question, on a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Haoyu Wang, as a 6.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Interesting. Could you please explain why you gave that specific rating?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I gave a rating of 6 because while Haoyu Wang was respectful and followed the rules of negotiation, he was also quite persistent in his efforts to secure a lower rent, which I found somewhat irritating as a landlord.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Understandable. Persistence can sometimes be seen as a positive trait in some contexts but can also be a negative one in negotiations. Now, my final question to you: at any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator
